metadata.title: CVE-2010-3393 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
magics-config in Magics++ 2.10.0 places a zero-length directory name in theLD_LIBRARY_PATH, which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojanhorse shared library in the current working directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3393` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmagics++-data - 2.18.15-5
libmagplus3v5 - 2.18.15-5
magics++ - 2.18.15-5
python-magics++ - 2.18.15-5
python3-magics++ - 2.18.15-5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: magics++ package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.15-5').
